text: Anthony José Zambrano de la Cruz (born 17 January 1998) is a Colombian sprinter. He won the silver medal at the 2019 World Championships in the 400 metres event, setting the new Colombian national record of 44.15 seconds. He was also a finalist of the 400 meters in the 2015 World Youth Championships in Athletics held in Cali, Colombia. The following year he was in the final of the 400 meters at the 2016 IAAF World U20 Championships in Bydgoszcz, Poland. He currently holds the national record and national record U23 in the 400 meters at 44.68 sec, which also becomes South American record U23https://consudatle.org/zambrano-44-68-en-400-record-sudamericano-u23/ and the second best historical mark of South America in the 400 meters. He won the 2018 South American Under-23 Championships in Athletics, setting the championship record. In 2019 he won the Pan American Games 400 meters in Lima, Peru. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:Colombian male sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of Colombia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:People from La Guajira Department Category:Pan American Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Pan American Games gold medalists for Colombia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 Pan American Games Category:Pan American Games competitors for Colombia Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Colombia Category:World Athletics Championships medalists Category:South American Championships in Athletics winners Category:Pan American Games gold medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Anthony Zambrano
